posts.name: Matthew L
posts.cooked:
Hi everyone,

Our team is switching from limelight to photonvision, and I tried to implement the example code on the photonvision docs , but it keeps crashing. Am I missing something?

Thanks in advance!

Here is the code (I can’t seem to get GitHub to work for some reason): Robot.java (7.5 KB)

link_counts.title: Aiming at a Target - PhotonVision Docs

posts.cooked:
Another_Person1:

but it keeps crashing

What do you mean by it keeps crashing? What does the error message say?

posts.name: Matthew L
posts.cooked:
Here is the screenshot and the log file of the error: image 578×566 18.1 KB code_troubleshooting.json (4.8 KB)

image 578×566 18.1 KB

image 578×566 18.1 KB

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: So it seems like at some point in your code you’re passing this.config to a Swerve controller. When you’re doing that, you need to  make sure this.config exists, otherwise it’ll throw this exception.

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked: It would be helpful if you shared your entire code project as a link to a repo on GitHub. Interestingly, the error usually isn’t in the file you’ve been looking at or think to share

posts.name: Matthew L
posts.cooked:
Finally managed to get github working:

GitHub - Another-Person1/FRC2025-Offseason Contribute to Another-Person1/FRC2025-Offseason development by creating an account on GitHub.

Contribute to Another-Person1/FRC2025-Offseason development by creating an account on GitHub.

It looks to me like this line in the Robot class is the issue:

You’re creating the swerve drive with most of the parameters set to null so when it attempts to use them it throws a NullPointerExeption and crashes the code.

posts.name: Matthew L
posts.cooked: I changed that to use the SwerveSubsytem.java file made by a different team member, but it still isn’t autoaligning. However, it isn’t crashing.

posts.name: Matthew L
posts.cooked:
